column4: linux-headers is just the headers, you'll need it to build modules and other things that need to talk to the kernel
linux-sources is the actually sources for the kernel. you'll need it and -headers to build a new kernel
how'd you get to the command line?
if you log out, GDM you give you an option to restart the X server
if not, logout, then hit ctrl+alt+backspace
that'll kill X, and GDM will restart it for you
then you just log in again
thanks for the answer... I'm curous tho. Why didn't they include -headers in -sources?
because you don't need -sources just to build 3rd party kernel modules
So you've got the .o files, and the .h just provides the implementation?
yes, but headers provide interface, and sources provide implementation
My mistake... ...So the (package)-dev things (for example... ...uh, firefox-dev if it exists) contains the headers _and_ the source?
i think the -dev packages just contain headers
Well then how would I go about compiling a software package like firefox from source?
What package would I go for if I was to build it from source then?
i think first yu have to tell synaptic or adept to include the sources repository
